intro: Leucas paucijuga, commonly known as the narrow-leaved leucas, is a flowering plant native to the eastern regions of South Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of pale blue to purple flowers. It typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, often in well-drained soils. Leucas paucijuga is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for various purposes.
